item.title: Vitaly Kim’s composure has transformed him into a national symbol of resistance https://t.co/CRQsa9nSKy

“The consequences of the Ukraine war will turn Russia into a ‘reduced energy power’,” writes Daniel Yergin in a guest essay for The Economist. “This marks the end of an era” that began with the collapse of the Soviet Union https://t.co/onxSJ3TDVo
A new, more assertive Germany is just what Europe needs to help it face down the menace in Moscow. It is just a shame it took a war to wake Europe’s sleeping giant https://t.co/AfXNVGpc6g
When his body was found it emerged that he had taken oﬀ his bulletproof vest to give it to a child he was carrying https://t.co/qfJAIXHXYx
Germany’s reaction to the war in Ukraine marks one of the biggest ruptures in German foreign and security policy since the second world war https://t.co/HysU8X4Md0
Vladimir Putin “thought he had leverage” when he launched the war while energy markets were very tight, says @DanielYergin. “But this has proved a serious miscalculation” https://t.co/tYiDYsjJWD
According to the Russian government, $300bn of its $630bn in reserves are now unusable https://t.co/6j3mfYRp2c

Xi Jinping is not like Vladimir Putin, who has no other way of exerting Russian influence than disruptive threats and the force of arms. What makes China different is that it has a stake in stability https://t.co/FM4UDVXLGe

Even in the absence of a full embargo, war-induced disruptions are already threatening food security in vulnerable nations, and could hit key European and American industries https://t.co/zhCzDwl5Of
The political scientist believes the reckless expansion of NATO provoked Russia. Writing in a guest essay for The Economist, he explains why https://t.co/2cdiRNnSuR

Ramzan Kadyrov’s men appear to have fared no better than the rest of the Russian forces https://t.co/ZD76mWEKxe

Russia’s foreign partners fail to understand who Vladimir Putin really is, warns Mikhail Khodorkovsky in a guest essay. “A bandit will always remain a bandit [...] It is a drastic mistake when he is seen as a normal statesman” https://t.co/IJ8aU8KZig

Vladimir Putin is a “pathological liar”, writes Lithuania’s prime minister @IngridaSimonyte. The West was too delusional in its negotiations with him, and “Russian money smelled too good” https://t.co/WkXKJhAKOv
They are symbols of Russia’s inadequate preparation for the campaign, as pertinent as its failures to neutralise Ukraine’s air defences and to shoot down its drones https://t.co/KDaDGk5jjr
“My parents don't know where I am”: @Wendell23 reports on the foreign volunteers fighting in Ukraine. From @1843mag https://t.co/u6g34GF5UM
How did Ramzan Kadyrov go from fighting against Russia to fighting for it, and what role will Chechen fighters play in Ukraine? https://t.co/O6D6RVOAl0

“Current leaders of Western countries have never dealt with thugs,” warns @mich261213. “War is evil to them, and the use of force is a last resort. This is not the case with Vladimir Putin” https://t.co/y3vYvcIwGL
Griffin, an American volunteer in Ukraine, transports refugees during the day and works remotely as a software engineer at night https://t.co/WYOSk1pOAW
The Joint Expeditionary Force, a British-led coalition of ten northern European countries, could be the first responder to Russian aggression—possibly before even NATO https://t.co/kSLLOV2wCD
The symbolic value of a foreign presence within the army is obvious: words of solidarity and weapons from abroad are good for soldiers’ morale https://t.co/q7GhJOKXLt

“I have been fighting a personal war with Vladimir Putin for nearly 20 years,” writes former oil mogul and political prisoner @mich261213. “That is why I look with despair at the defeatist approach of Western leaders” https://t.co/X8jtmBzSR8
No matter how the war in Ukraine unfolds, China will treat its relationship with the Kremlin as a means of boosting Chinese power, not Russia’s https://t.co/dMhsE0gwxu
Suleiman the Magnificent established Islam’s place in Europe. In the five centuries since, his personality and achievements have never ceased to puzzle and fascinate https://t.co/RpTtxsc8P8
Unlike NATO, the Joint Expeditionary Force does not need consensus among members to deploy troops in a crisis. It can do things that NATO cannot https://t.co/nBQJgWdJHO

Vladimir Putin is isolated and morally dead. He is turning himself into a 21st-century Stalin, resorting as never before to lies, violence and paranoia. Think what Russia might become once freed from him https://t.co/M7x4WAfyZB
Mentions of “war”, frowned upon by the Kremlin, have risen sharply, as have “scary”, “ashamed” and “horror” https://t.co/i0d9tfPMRK
Poland is nearer the eye of the storm than any other NATO member. It wants to do as much as possible, but there are incalculable risks https://t.co/B8LXS4ewXU

⚡️There are more than 300,000 members of the official “IT Army” of Ukraine, a Telegram group of volunteer cyber-warriors set up by the government, and an increasing number of unofficial groups.
Their aim is to spread chaos in Russia https://t.co/JHwW3pK7pY
Indian officials calculate, probably correctly, that their country will suffer few consequences from the West because of its stance on the war in Ukraine https://t.co/DIQUsfUkSf
To stop Russia’s invasion “we need to win the info war”, one Ukrainian hacker tells @1843mag https://t.co/5REgQpJTsO

“This war is [Vladimir] Putin’s way of testing the democratic world and it is an attempt to break our democratic spirit,” writes the president of Kosovo. Instead, @VjosaOsmaniPRKS argues, it has done the opposite https://t.co/mB5lRlOito
Russia faces a deep recession. But rather than relent, Vladimir Putin may double down on his attempts to cut the country off from the outside world https://t.co/r33Jbfk2DP
If Russia triumphs, it is likely to be through sheer mass https://t.co/RylVJMe8SY

“Russia’s president pursues a dangerous imperialist policy that permits one country to choose the fate of another simply because it has the military might,” says @VjosaOsmaniPRKS https://t.co/NQZha4gQMI

The EU now estimates that up to 7m people may seek refuge abroad https://t.co/ZnbCFQVTr3
The official global toll is 6m. But we find that there is a 95% chance that the true value lies between 14m and 23.7m additional deaths https://t.co/e3B65pAy4U
As Russia sinks, the contrast with the president next door is glaring. Volodymyr Zelensky is Vladimir Putin’s antithesis—and perhaps his nemesis https://t.co/KstlQod9nb

Ukraine has destroyed, damaged or captured at least 1,054 pieces of Russian equipment, about four times as many as it has lost to Russia, say analysts.
These figures are far from perfect, but read how they provide a glimpse through the fog of war ⬇️
These weapons can destroy delicate lung tissue or force air into the bloodstream, causing a massive embolism without leaving external signs of injury https://t.co/xDuzrR96tz
Also know as “vacuum bombs”, these horrifying weapons can suck the air out of victims’ lungs https://t.co/J4Yhq873oO
The military difficulties the Russians are having may lead China to rethink the feasibility of an invasion across the Taiwan strait https://t.co/x15S5GnF76
They have been mockingly dubbed by Western analysts as “emotional-support armour” or “cope cages” https://t.co/pEoZz5jvO6
